newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real rises 0.26 pct on dollar inflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real rises 0.26 pct on dollar inflows.

text.p: Brazil's real rose 0.26 percent to close at 1.0577 per greenback on dollar inflows in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.

Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Thursday deficit of $25 million. But dealers expected it would turn out to be a large surplus when all transactions were registered.
"People were talking about a large financial buy operation. Something between $600 million and $1 billion", a dealer said.
Some traders were expecting April's first decline in the reais-dollar mini-band on Friday. The current mini-band was set on Monday at between 1.0570 and 1.0620 reais per dollar.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real closed steady at 1.0636 per dollar.
In the illegal parallel market, the real ended at 1.130 per greenback, up 0.44 percent.
